messages.description: Tag for a warning message
messages.C: WARNING

messages.description: Tag for an error message
messages.C: ERROR

messages.description: Tag for an unrecognised exception
messages.C: Unrecognized exception

messages.description: Unable to open the file called {0} for reading.
messages.C: Unable to open file {0} for reading.

messages.description: The message catalogue being processed contains multiple definitions of the set {0}
messages.C: Message catalog contains multiple definitions of set {0}.
messages.en_GB: Message catalogue contains multiple definitions of set {0}.

messages.description: The offset of the given message array is out side the bounds of the catalogue file.
messages.C: Message array offset outside bounds of message catalog.
messages.en_GB: Message array offset outside bounds of message catalogue.

messages.description: The message in set {0} with message ID {1} has been defined multiple times.
messages.C: Multiple definitions of message with ID {0}.{1}.

messages.description: We encountered an unexpected end-of-file indicator
messages.C: Unexpected end of file indicator.

messages.description: Quote characters should be a single character, or left empty to clear quoting.
messages.C: Quote should be a single character or empty to clear.

messages.description: A message number should be followed by a space.
messages.C: Message number should be followed by a space.

messages.description: A string that begins with a quote character does not have one at the end.
messages.C: String starts with a quote but does not end with one.

messages.description: Warns that we are replacing the text for the existing message in set {0} with message ID {1}.
messages.C: Replacing existing message ID {0}.{1}.

messages.description: The catalogue is not as large as the header claims.
messages.C: Message catalogue is not as large as it claims.

messages.description: The format of the input line is unrecognised.
messages.C: Unrecognised line contents.

messages.description: A message catalogue is too short to contain a valid header.
messages.C: Message catalog is too short to be valid.
messages.en_GB: Message catalogue is too short to be valid.

messages.description: The message catalogue does not start with the appropriate magic header.
messages.C: File does not start with message catalog magic.
messages.en_GB: File does not start with message catalogue magic.

messages.description: The message catalogue is not marked as being version 1.
messages.C: File is not a version 1 message catalog.
messages.en_GB: File is not a version 1 message catalogue.

messages.description: One of the reserved fields in the header is not 0.
messages.C: Reserved field is not 0.

messages.description: The message catalogue size on disk is larger than the size claimed in the header.
messages.C: Message catalog is larger than it claims.
messages.en_GB: Message catalogue is larger than it claims.

messages.description: A table entry in a message catalogue is outside the bounds of the file.
messages.C: Table is outside bounds of message catalog.
messages.en_GB: Table is outside bounds of message catalogue.

messages.description: A table entry in a message catalogue is not aligned to an eight byte boundary within the file.
messages.C: Table entry is not aligned to 8-byte boundary.

messages.description: The message (set {0}, message {1}) starts beyond the end of the message catalogue.
messages.C: Message {0}.{1} starts beyond the end of the message catalog.
messages.en_GB: Message {0}.{1} starts beyond the end of the message catalogue.

messages.description: The message (set {0}, message{1}) ends beyond the end of the message cataloguue.
messages.C: Message {0}.{1} overflows the end of the message catalog.
messages.en_GB: Message {0}.{1} overflows the end of the message catalogue.

messages.description: The message (set {0}, message{1}) is longer than the entire length of the message file.
messages.C: Message {0}.{1} is longer than the length of the message catalog.
messages.en_GB: Message {0}.{1} is longer than the length of the message catalogue.

messages.description: The message (set {0}, message{1}) does not have a terminating NUL-character.
messages.C: Message {0}.{1} is not terminated by a NUL-character.

messages.description: A given ID {0} is too large for the Id data type.  This is a hard error.
messages.C: ID {0} is too large.

messages.description: A given ID {0} is larger than the soft limit {2}.  The soft limit is called {1} - which is a symbolic name.  This is a soft-error.
messages.C: ID {0} is larger than {1} ({2}).

messages.description: All IDs must be greater than or equal to 1. ID {0} isn't.
messages.C: ID {0} is too small, must be at least 1.

messages.description: The command line takes at least one message catalogue and one message file as arguments.  {0} is the display version of the program name.
messages.C: {0}: Need to specify a message catalog and at least one message file.
messages.en_GB: {0}: Need to specify a message catalogue and at least one message file.

messages.description: Command line usage of the programme.
messages.C: Usage: {0} <msg_file> <cat_file>...

messages.description: Unable to remove the file {1}. {0} is the programme name.
messages.C: {0}: Unable to remove file: {1}.

messages.description: Unable to rename the file {1} to {2}. We will leave the temporary file ({1}) in place.  {0} is the program name.
messages.C:
{0}: Unable to rename file {1} to {2}.
{0}: Leaving temporary file in place.
